reviews.text: Yet another amazing state capitol with its own take on its state heritage. Little Rock continues to play with some great identities over the past 50 years and this building continues to follow what makes some of these identities so great. The Clinton Library being right down the road does not necessarily take away from the Capitol's thunder as much as you might think. The whole financial room where you get to play with real money is really cool to say the least.
So beautiful! A great place to take kids so they can see where government takes place.
Beautiful Christmas lights and decorations. Make sure you go inside.

Our experience here was the height of southern hospitality. The Senate chamber was locked, but a senator let us in, gave us a personal tour, and then chatted with us for an hour! The Treasury let us into the safe and we got to hold hundreds of thousands of dollars, plus they took our photo for us to download and gave us souvenir coins. The governor's office was super nice and gave us pens, then let us in to tour the office and meet the chief of staff. The entire place was friendly and the building has an elegance that is hard to beat. Plus they have free parking. Great afternoon for our family and made us feel very welcome in Arkansas.
We went to the Arkansas State Capital and loved it! It is a great place to visit and explore! Very nice place!

I believe it is a great program for those of us whom suffer from any form of mental illness and even better for those whom don't suffer from mental illness, but may have a friend/family whom does suffer from some sort of mental illness. It would be an even better program if they had a program at Pinnacle House that has something like that for loved ones whether it be friends/family and educated them with the stuff they educate us that do have a mental illness. That's the only reason I have 4 stars. If they had that sort of program or offered that sort of educational classes to beyond us with mental illness, but rather folks whom don't have a mental illness, but have a loved one who does! If they offered that, they'd get 5 stars from me! 😀

Worst place on earth, to be if you LIke to Overeat and drink too many sodas and like to eat!  they hate flirty pretty men that like to call Women girls and fine ladies.  They Label alcoholics and marijuana patients as if they have a mental illness  what the hell is mental health if you are in the early stages of stomach cancer!  That little rock community mental health center tried to make me think my love for Heather and Victoria those very fine "clients at that group place"  Not going there in my dreams, I hang on to them!

A good organization that has educational displays and animals. They have age targeted scavenger hunts to help engaged the children. They win a pin for completing it. Out back they have a working micro farm and garden complete with animals. The staff is friendly and informative. We asked about a strange machine and a nice gentleman explained it was a worm rocket. He told us all about it, showed us worm casing it had sifted, then he took us to the worm bins and spent half an hour teaching us about them. Now we can start our own worm farm to help improve our soil! The gift shop also had a magnet (what we always try to get as our souvenir) and it was only $.25, though most of the gift shop was too expensive for us. The kids really enjoyed petting the goats and seeing the lamas and pigs.

What!!! Google, you should provide a 20 star rating!!! I love that this group wants to reduce poverty and illiteracy!!! Their Urban Farm is a great way to utlize space in a way that doesn't sacrifice farming and ranching space. I love that they are working to save the environment as well! Their museum tells us about the hardships some people face, and how Heifer and us can solve them!!!

Outstanding! What? No 10 star rating available?  The location, the mission, the building, the staff, the restaurant, the gift shop,  and the animals...if you are anywhere near Little Rock, make this a must on your to-do list. It is near the Clinton Library, so you can make it a double-header.
A fun, smart, and free outing for the family
My daughter loves to go visit all the animals at the barn and I love the fresh veggies. The exhitbit hall is great too.

A good organization that has educational displays and animals. They have age targeted scavenger hunts to help engaged the children. They win a pin for completing it. Out back they have a working micro farm and garden complete with animals. The staff is friendly and informative. We asked about a strange machine and a nice gentleman explained it was a worm rocket. He told us all about it, showed us worm casing it had sifted, then he took us to the worm bins and spent half an hour teaching us about them. Now we can start our own worm farm to help improve our soil! The gift shop also had a magnet (what we always try to get as our souvenir) and it was only $.25, though most of the gift shop was too expensive for us. The kids really enjoyed petting the goats and seeing the lamas and pigs.

What!!! Google, you should provide a 20 star rating!!! I love that this group wants to reduce poverty and illiteracy!!! Their Urban Farm is a great way to utlize space in a way that doesn't sacrifice farming and ranching space. I love that they are working to save the environment as well! Their museum tells us about the hardships some people face, and how Heifer and us can solve them!!!

Outstanding! What? No 10 star rating available?  The location, the mission, the building, the staff, the restaurant, the gift shop,  and the animals...if you are anywhere near Little Rock, make this a must on your to-do list. It is near the Clinton Library, so you can make it a double-header.
A fun, smart, and free outing for the family
My daughter loves to go visit all the animals at the barn and I love the fresh veggies. The exhitbit hall is great too.

What a beautiful exhibition ! The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. They made sure to make us feel more than welcomed and gave us a bit of insight into the art and building. Definitely recommend stopping by!

I purchased tickets online and someone else from my church purchased tickets for me as well. So I have a total of 12 tickets. I spoke to Allison Shaw to see if I could get refunded for the 6 tickets that I have that I will not be using today or the new future. She refused to refund me my money of $65.45. Although, I still have 6 tickets that were purchased earlier. She offered to exchange for another show but that included a fee as well. I am highly disappointed in AR Arts Center. This is will be my last time attending a show here.

Dining at Canvas restaurant located inside the Arkansas Art Center was terrific. We held our sister's birthday party there. The manager and staff went over and beyond the call of duty. The food was excellent!

Art Center contains.....wait for it....

Works of art. Yeah, I know...mind blowing!
It was very nice and quiet and it was wonderful to see the old and new in art culture.

I was invited to an event on last week and it was over the top. Impressive photos, impressive music and impressive food.  Did I say impressive?  The event was from 6 to 8, and everything was timely.  I love it when folks pay attention to the schedule.  Parking situation is a bit desirable - very limited parking.
Beautiful building that displays the rich history of some Arkansas African Americans.
Great historical site. Staff are wonderful. Asset to the community.

I really enjoyed this museum, I learned a lot about the historic 9th Street District and I will definitely be back again. Don’t forget to check the Hall of Fame upstairs. They also have a really nice shop.
Filled with historical information. Very interesting.

i went here because i love old houses and buildings but i found this museum to be very interesting. a lot of different things to see. plus i was greeted by a smile and a really friendly girl that was extremely nice as were very employee there. so very helpful and gave me some great  tips on other places to see.  i really enjoyed my visit to this museum.
Neat free museum. Came here with my 5 year old son. He loved the train/dress up room. I enjoyed seeing the architecture of the old state house and the various exhibits.
This place is really neat and historic. I went there for a school project and the employees were very helpful in finding information for me and pointing out the things specific to my project.

A lot of the rooms on the second floor are getting new installations. A person wouldn't know if s/he could climb stairs. Since my son and I have to use the elevator, we had to have a guard escort us through some areas. I felt rushed because she was waiting on us to take her lunch.

Great place to learn about history of your state and the background of the characters that shook the politics of our past.  A great place to take the family to spend several hours reading about the events that make a part of modern day politics.

Beautifully decorated home. Attended an open house around Christmas time in 2016 with my grandmother. Mr. and Mrs. Hutchison were extremely friendly when we met them. We had a wonderful time seeing all the different rooms in the house. The place was packed and everyone seemed to be having a great experience. The staff members were all very professional and the grounds were kept well. Overall it was an extremely rewarding experience and I hope they will hold another event like this again sometime soon.

Immaculately well kept grounds and manicured landscaping. This building is historically at the center of what happens in Little Rock and is filled with a busy schedule of galas, meetings, hosting and other events.

As a Arkansas governor a member of the Senate my stay at the Arkansas Governor's Mansion was absolutely wonderful I look forward to returning there soon so that we may complete our wonderous entrance into this Next Century thank you General levester Brown
I've had a few events here and the staff is always above expectation. The food service is also as delicious as it looks.
The staff did an amazing job at The Exodus Project event. Beautiful!
This was a great exhibit for kids. The dinosaurs looked so real. We had a blast!

This is the 2nd time I've been here.  My granddaughter was in a volleyball tournament.  
Nice, clean and attractive venue.
Great facilities and every time I visit I love the artwork in the halls. The climate controls are sometimes off so carry a light jacket.

Went to the RV show.  Seems like the same stuff from the same dealers.  They usually only have one or two class A diesels.  Some people love to see more of those and more small vendors who sale crafts.
Had so much fun rooms were clean food was great this is a really good place to set up conventions. There's even lots of different food within walking distance.

Presidential Libraries and Museums offer a strong sense of self worth to the family of our past commander and chiefs, and this one is no different. It would be Clinton who would have his library have a stronger commercial approach, without sacrificing the architecture, which is by no means a bad thing. And yes one does learn a lot about the Clinton family and anything Lewinsky related is noticeably absent.

Absolutely stunning 21st century architecture, library, and space.

My thanks to the entire staff everywhere we went. 1st. To the staff of the restaurant: We got there 15 minutes before 2pm when it closed. They welcomed us in with no problem.  Sat us at a clean table from what had clearly been a busy lunch. The young African-American waiter was the nicest young man- I asked for a "buttery chardonnay" and he picked the right one.

I now keep the wine in my home. I tell people "If it's good enough for Bill and Hillary, it's good enough for you."

They serve THE best Club Sandwhich in Little Rock.

The gift shop is wonderful. Again, the staff was incredibly nice to my father and I. The limo, the Cabinet Room, it is all a fantastic way to spend the afternoon. The short video is worth watching twice.

I am told it is modeled after Trinity College, with gigantic bookcases and a stunning view of the river and downtown Little Rock. A truly amazing tour.

Just had my third visit here since it opened. i was there on April 5 and as with previous visits, it didn't disappoint. It's a beautiful structure, right on the Arkansas River and so well designed. I was a teenager when he was President he became my hero at a young age so for me, it's like a trip down memory lane and a place I can go and relive my adolescence from the 1990's. The staff is wonderful, and I actually did a guided tour this time and the guides were incredible. It was just so much fun and I learned so much. I love the history of it all and it's great to see so many visitors. The President was there the day I was, he was in town that weekend for events in Little Rock and Hope and so there was a buzz of activity around the building. I mean, if you really hate the Clintons you won't like it, but if you at least appreciate history and his presidency, it's a great place. And it's only $10 to get in.
There's so much history in this museum. I always love visiting. Make sure you block off several hours and enjoy the tours. Don't forget to grab a little food while you are here.
Very nice and neat Presidential Library and informative. The 42 restaurant had excellent food and reasonably priced. The staff was very friendly.

This is a really nice facility. Well laid out, clean, decent food at the kiosks/restaurants. 
Everyone is helpful and knowledgeable,  happy to answer questions. 
If you live in the state a membership is the way to go.
If you do not (just visiting) then any donations go to on site use AND national/international conservation programs.

I love our zoo. I feel happy making it the primary place to take my year old son for outings. 
The staff there are always beaming with their love of the animals and the community. They never stop consistently working on improving the living spaces for the animals. I know some say zoos are animal jails but I firmly feel that everyone employed there only wants the best environment and attention to the conservation of the species housed at the Little Rock Zoo.

This wasn't a bad zoo, but there was a lot of construction and a ton of exhibits were closed! But, I understand they're trying to improve things. I do recommend they update their signs, there were several times we were walking around in circles trying to determine where we should be.

Highly recommend getting a year pass if having a family because it's a great place to bring kids. Always appreciate staff who show kids snakes or other animals up close. Food truck food can be a bit overpriced, but tasty - can't say the same for the cafeteria food. Kids loved the penguins, but don't get fooled by "penguin parties" held outside the zoo. Trust me, it's no party. Anyway, the zoo is great!!

Very nice facility.  Well laid out,  with great views of animals.
The zoo, including public areas, animal enclosures,  restrooms are clean.
The animals look great, are provided with various forms of enrichment including training, foraging,  keeper interactions,  "toys"  and more.
I was very impressed. 
Hanna (our tour guide) was EXCELLENT- informative,  and made the tour fun AND educational. Gold stars for Hanna!!
Many of the zoo purchases either go to animal care, facility maintenance or national and international conservation programs. 
We bought a family membership since we live in the state; if you're "just visiting " donations will help support conservation.

Such a gem for Arkansas and Little Rock. This is an outstanding park. Take the East trail up and the west trail down for a scenic loop. Don't be afraid to go off trail in the boulder field and steep rock areas. It's a blast to scramble around on. One of the best places in all the south to quickly get exposure without a lot of effort.

They have several trails to reach the top of pinnacle or a trail to walk the base. There are public bathrooms and a playground at one location. There campgrounds as well. This state park seems smaller and we haven't found many other activities to do except climb to the top. It is a unique climb and challenging. It is also a beautiful view once you do reach the top.

Very great place in the warmer months to hike up the mountain. The park is very clean and safe. I see lots of families have birthday parties and grill out here in the summer months. Has a great big fields. Once you reach the top of the mountain it is totally worth all the walking because the view is absolutely gorgeous. If you are scared of heights I definitely recommend it
Best place to drive your legs straight up a mountain. Lots of land to do whatever you feel like doing. Just please pick up any trash you see. Keep our land's clean. Peace

This is a wonderful State Park. Lots of interesting hiking places including views of the rivers and Downtown Little Rock from the top of Pinnacle Mountain. If climbing to the top, the east trail is more challenging. The west trail is easier but there are still some challenges there as well
Love the artsy vibe of Argenta District of North Little Rock Arkansas
Love all the shops and restaurants down here. They've done a good job revitalizing it.
Good area for drinks, food, and entertainment.  Decent parking unless there's an event at Verizon.
Its expanding and becoming the new downtown love it!!

Large area at dog bark. Lots for the pups to smell and sticks to play with. 
Playground are great, I love that they are marked for age groups. Would give 5 stars if they had open restrooms and water fountains.
This place is cool!  Trails, a neat dock, covered bridge, playground, soccer field, bike park.  This will definitely be somewhere we spend a lot of time at while we live in Arkansas
I love to bring my 5 year old here to play on the many playground structures to choose from. He loved the rocket ship one in particular. Always clean and very scenic and beautiful.
Held my husbands birthday party at The Heritage Room in burns park and it was GREAT! Plenty of space for food & dancing. Our DJ had plenty of space also... overall 10

Large park with lots of play areas for kids. I grew up here going to this park and was sad to see the old rocket slide is gone but they did put in a new, large play equipment with multiple slides that the kids got to enjoy. The new slide is rocket-themed. I was happy to see that the Army tank and train caboose is still there and looking great!

Family fun place to visit and enjoy some baseball, delicious snacks and fireworks! We have enjoyed some good times here. The location is a bit dated as far as the structure and the entertainment. The firework display did not disappoint though!
Beautiful ballpark to go too. Great view of downtown LR from inside the park. They always have promotions and giveaways going on during the season. Tickets are very well priced and affordable.
Awesome park, great place to catch a game. Very family friendly and also has a beer garden. Love watching the travs here!
The best ball park I have ever been to. Clean convenient to all to get to. Easy parking, very helpful workers,  great hospitality. Great value for a family. Will buy season tickets.
I love this place. Great atmosphere and a good baseball team.    Never go wrong attending any Event there.

We walked into this warm and friendly coffeehouse to be greeted by a delicious range of cakes (as shown in the photo) and the smell of home cooking. The food is superb and reasonably priced. The staff are friendly, efficient and serve you quickly. This is a popular place with locals and the long opening hours help to spread out the demand. We returned here every day for breakfast which was far superior to the hotel we were staying in. Well worth a visit for breakfast lunch or tea. Recommend the chocolate penut butter stack cake, delicious.😋
Great menu choices. Really kind and helpful staff. Cute place. Excellent food. Glad we found this one.
Cosy, small pleasant atmosphere. Good prices and great service
Great little place - visited with my daughter and the staff were really nice. We had a light snacks but my daughter said it was the best Cheese toastie she's ever had! Will visit again
Lamb stew was amazing.  Staff very helpful xxxx glad a table was reserved for us as we cycled 50 miles in headwinds all the way and it was worth it!

I've never seen a tug boat go through the channels with a load before. That was pretty sweet to watch. It was interesting to learn how the channels worked. The view from the middle of the bridge is gorgeous. I didn't get the chance to throw it into my excercise routine, but I think it'd be a good addition. I don't like spiders, so I didn't like to get close to either side of the bridge to get a better view. But, there's nothing that can be done about them.

Brought the family here for a stroll. Scenic and serene. Plenty of parking. Walkways were fairly clean, but there were indications of pet traffic. Most people seemed pretty good about picking up for their pets. We only stayed for about an hour, but I imagine the sunset would have been pretty epic from here.
Huge cool. We were there a year ago today. It was cold, but extremly cool!
Great place to visit and walk.  I loved the views of the Arkansas River from the top of the bridge.
Beautiful views. Great place to walk or jog!

Such a gem for Arkansas and Little Rock. This is an outstanding park. Take the East trail up and the west trail down for a scenic loop. Don't be afraid to go off trail in the boulder field and steep rock areas. It's a blast to scramble around on. One of the best places in all the south to quickly get exposure without a lot of effort.

They have several trails to reach the top of pinnacle or a trail to walk the base. There are public bathrooms and a playground at one location. There campgrounds as well. This state park seems smaller and we haven't found many other activities to do except climb to the top. It is a unique climb and challenging. It is also a beautiful view once you do reach the top.

Very great place in the warmer months to hike up the mountain. The park is very clean and safe. I see lots of families have birthday parties and grill out here in the summer months. Has a great big fields. Once you reach the top of the mountain it is totally worth all the walking because the view is absolutely gorgeous. If you are scared of heights I definitely recommend it
Best place to drive your legs straight up a mountain. Lots of land to do whatever you feel like doing. Just please pick up any trash you see. Keep our land's clean. Peace

This is a wonderful State Park. Lots of interesting hiking places including views of the rivers and Downtown Little Rock from the top of Pinnacle Mountain. If climbing to the top, the east trail is more challenging. The west trail is easier but there are still some challenges there as well

Family fun place to visit and enjoy some baseball, delicious snacks and fireworks! We have enjoyed some good times here. The location is a bit dated as far as the structure and the entertainment. The firework display did not disappoint though!
Beautiful ballpark to go too. Great view of downtown LR from inside the park. They always have promotions and giveaways going on during the season. Tickets are very well priced and affordable.
Awesome park, great place to catch a game. Very family friendly and also has a beer garden. Love watching the travs here!
The best ball park I have ever been to. Clean convenient to all to get to. Easy parking, very helpful workers,  great hospitality. Great value for a family. Will buy season tickets.
I love this place. Great atmosphere and a good baseball team.    Never go wrong attending any Event there.
The food here is great i really liked the fish tacos! Also my drinks were really good and half off for happy hour! I also enjoyed the free show on the patio.

I was there 7-19-14 for lunch.  The "famous fajitas" were less than impressive.  Not even a hint of seasoning on the meat or veg.  When you cook, you HAVE to use salt at the very least.  This is not optional.  The salt shaker on the table should not be the first line of seasoning that food sees.  Actually, if the food was seasoned right when cooked, there is no need to even have a salt shaker at the table.

The wife did enjoy the beans and her soup, however.

If visiting this area again, I wouldn't go back for food.  Maybe for a drink and music, but I would pass on the food.

Great ambiance on the patio.  Food was excellent.  Wonderfull Happy Hour Specials.  Servers and Bartenders provided excellent service. Great mix of Tex Mex as well as Asian Fusion.  Sound system in the concert venue was excellent.

my first visit to their river market location was very disappointing. service was absolutely horrible, food took way to long to get out to us, then it was cold, bland and unappealing.  husband's order was wrong so on top of waiting for the food to arrive, we had to wait even longer for his order to be corrected.  Couldn't get the waiter to check back to see if we needed drinks.  Went to the bar to get a drink only to have the bartender ignore me.  There were no other people at the bar except a waitress who he made drinks for and then never approached me. luckily the waiter saw me and asked me if I needed anything, I said "we" as in the whole table, needed drinks, he asked me as we walked back to our table what I wanted and he went and got it and then didn't ask the other people at the table what they needed.  Seems to be no organization and lacking in management.  I say that because I later found out that the bar tender who ignored me was a "manager".  The waiters and waitresses and buss boys seem to be running around like chickens with their heads cut off.  I came to see a concert and was surprised to see no tables or chairs upstairs in the concert area.  The only thing that would bring me back is another concert and ONLY if it's a really good one and I will eat elsewhere before I go.
Juanita's is such a fun venue! It's got live music, food, and drinks. What more could you want? It's definitely worth the visit if you're looking for something to do!
Great spot.  We went on a Thursday night and there was live music.  Really enjoyed it.  Food was good. Food and drinks are both fairly priced. You can have a great time for little money.

I love the Cubano Sandwich! Those french fries with the dill ranch dressing are insane. I can stop eating then. The house made potato chips are great to but could use a little more salt. Great place to eat any time of day or night. Hit like if you agree!
Wonderful service and fabulous sandwiches. The atmosphere was very quirky with plenty of neat lounge space. Also live music! I'll definitely come back to try their chicken and sauces!

The sticky fingers are dry and can find better meals at a fast food restaurant.  Paid 10.00 for a cover charge and left before the band started.  Spent 45.00 and left horribly disappointed.  Band might have been find but service was horrible and the food was terrible.  Sauce flavors were not good either.  What the heck.  World famous?   No. Not at all.  Why is this place even open.

Place was unique, food was pretty good but nothing tasting a crazy amount better than any other 4 star restaurant. I would definitely go back again. Staff was friendly and place was pretty clean. It is a bit darker and kinda small inside. But the booths were large. Would be a great place to do large group dinners. If you rented the place out for the dinner. Might be a bit crowded if the general public was also there.

Busy. Nice that there is valet parking because very limited parking space. Very busy on Saturday night but not overcrowded as they don't try and pack in as many people as possible. Somewhat upscale establishment but not to the point of feeling uncomfortable. Food was good but, from the opinions of some of my friends who had gone before me, I expected it to be much better than what it was. Portion size is good for the price. Will go again but will have cocktails at home first. Oh, and it was an inviting surprise when one of the owners mingled throughout the evening to check on patrons and shake hands.

Very good dinner, service, drinks, atmosphere. I was not disappointed and will be back. I had the lobster grilled cheese that was probably the best sandwich I've ever had.  My BF had a steak with the mashed potatoes. Everything was phenomenal. And to boot, the manager came out and apologized for our wait and offered us dessert on the house. That was a nice touch and very much appreciated.  The dessert was also fantastic. We will definitely be back.

The food was amazing. Our server Chloe was great. And before the end of the meal one of the owners came by the table to ensure everything was great. Very pleasant. Great atmosphere, great food, and potent drinks! Highly recommended and will be back soon.

I have dined and Petit & Keet many many times before last night without any incident.  The food, atmosphere, and service has ALWAYS been amazing!!!  Last night my friends and I decided to dine and sit on the fire pit area.  Service was good until we had an extra party join us.  Mr. Dylan walks to the table huffs and puffs as if we are inconveniencing him.  He states he is never going home tonight and asks should be be transferring the ticket because it’s past time for him to go.  The entire table let a bit uncomfortable.  We in turn tell him yes he should transfer the ticket so he can go home because we’re still eating, socializing, and enjoying our evening.  He ultimately refuses to but i don’t feel like we should feel rushed or a burden to someone where we are spending our money.  What really iced the cake was when we asked for a desert menu and his response was “I AM THE DESERT”. EXCUSE ME!!!  I will definitely be visiting PK again but never will I allow Mr. Dylan to wait on me.  This incident shifted the entire focus and conversation of the party.  Although i feel like the service was horrible and disrespectful...enjoy the 20% tip.

Very trendy spot for a nice date. We enjoyed the food and our server was attentive and prompt. The ox tail mac&cheese was incredible!! My only complaint was that it was a little noisy for comfortable conversation, but we were there during a Friday dinner rush.  Overall, we really enjoyed it!
Great food and good service! Really enjoyed our meal. Wish we had known about this place for years

Not the "highest-end" steak place in Little Rock, but it's priced well and I've never had a bad steak there. Sides are all good. Wine list is short but well priced, and you are welcome to bring your own bottle. Staff is always very pleasant although they do occasionally get spread thin. It's a very safe option for a steak house, but if you're looking for something special, I'd recommend Arthur's or Sonny Williams

I had a nice bone-in ribeye. It was prepared competently. Over all, I'd say they are riding on their reputation. I would get a better steak at home on my own grill and at these prices at a competitive restaurant overall the food experience would be better.
I cant remember the last time i had a good quality juicy steak but i can remember this one! They have the best steaks in the country. Highly recommended!

Not a great steak. Went in on a Friday night and it was pretty slow. I came in from out of town and this place was near the hotel I was staying at. The steak was overcooked but had a gamey taste as well as very tough. The salad had turned as well. The service was good though. Our waiter and the hostess were polite and attentive which is why they get a 2 instead of a 1.

Hops is a cute little restaurant.  Sadly, I found the food lacking in quality and flavor.  The Pub Burger was good sized, but so lacking in flavor! And the fries obviously came from a bag, as did the chicken strips my daughter had. The smoked salmon and beet salad was tasty. The desserts were odd. We were there as a group, so shared the cheese cake, creme brule, and chocolate mousse. I found one taste of each more than sufficient because, again, the flavors just fell flat. 

The wait staff were friendly, and it was surprisingly comfortable having a toddler and several older kids in our party, despite the restaurant's cozy size.

For the price, I had higher expectations.

When Hops first opened we waited in a long line to get in but once we did it was well worth it, delicious. The second time we went there was no line and the food was only mediocre...we havent seen the longs lines that used to be there in a long time. Wondering if they lost a good cook or something... Still a nice place, just no where near as good food as at first.
Awesome burgers. The flavor was outstanding. Service was great as well.

Have walked by this place many time, but finally came in. Ordered the Hops Burn Burger and have to say that it was one of the greatest burgers I have eaten. Got the chipotle cold slaw with it, and it was delicious also. A dark beer chased it all down. Overall a great place!
Only once was I there. The food , prices , and service was inviting ! I definitely plan on going back , next time with family and or friends !!
Probably the best service I've ever experienced.
Maya Ritas are great.

Great service! Great atmosphere! Indoor restaurant—eclectic style and outdoor patio that is dog friendly! =) The food was Fantastic! 

My husband ordered their Amy’s Turkey Pesto sandwich and I ordered the White Truffle Mac & Cheese! Mine came with a salad which was delicious as well! 

We’ve dinned here in the past and it was good but this time everything was spectacular! =)

Went here for my graduation dinner 12/16/2017. This place the food and the employees was so everything to me and my more than expected guest which they accommodate like a pro...It's uniquely Beautiful with lots of food for your money.... Love spending and going to places that reflect diversity and all are welcome..This place is it. I mean just look at the true reviews. Thank you Dizzys... I'll be back with another big dinner party....love it live it

Food was great. I ordered the Brie salad and a friend suggested I change the dressing to the house made Parmesan peeper vinaigrette.   What a great choice.  I only had lunch this time but I will be back for dinner.  Unfortunately when you are downtown parking can be a challenge but don’t let that scare you off the food is worth the parking space hunt.  Also our waitstaff was very attentive and good. Overall atmosphere was a plus and I like the New Orleans vide they have going on.  I believe this is an off shoot from a restaurant that was or may still be in Benton Arkansas but I’m not certain.  Regardless give it a try you will enjoy the food. 🙌🙌

Was referred here and I was not disappointed! The ambiance, the quick attention of the staff, and the food were all excellent. 
The cheese dip's reputation preceded it and thanks L.A. for making me aware! It was awesome.

The club sandwich was a hit as was the bacon, egg, and cheddar burger. Large portions cooked to perfection are the norm here it seems. 

Will definitely make it a regular stop when in Little Rock. Thanks Emily and Dakota for making my first visit a pleasant and memorable one.
This place is really cool. The food is excellent and reasonably priced. The staff is friendly. The cheeseburger I got was so big I could barley for it in my mouth. Very delicious!!

Today was my first time going and I LOVED IT!!! They are super clean and really friendly. I went to get prom nails done and they did EXACTLY what I wanted, turned out great. I brought my friend and got her nails done too and we were only there for just an hour and they had us both done. This is the place I will continue to come to for sure. ❤️

I had such a great experience at Julie’s Nail Salon. The staff is so friendly along with being professional. They not only listened to what I wanted for my nails they actually did it too. Most nail salons just do what they want without caring for the customer. Not here, they actually care. My nails look so amazing. Also everyone there knows how to do designs. Good ones too!! I had such a relaxing experience. The wait time was very little. I’m so pleased. I would definitely come here again as well as recommend it to others. Thank you guys for such a pleasant experience.

I’ve been coming to this salon for ten years! Before it was called Julie’s. Today was the verrrryyyyyy last day I will come in. I came in with a broke nail because of them being very thin, so I asked the guy if I can get all of them fixed to where they’re not thin he says no. So he continues to fix the nail that was cracked and chipped . I said well this nail is thicker than my other nails he says “So I don’t care”, with a shoulder shrug!!! The idea is to give the customers what they’re wanting not for you to suggest what they should have. My nails could’ve been fixed the way I wanted them to be. I’m paying for it not you. It’s only one person that does beautiful nails in this shop. I liked Tara’s Nails better. She was more warm and made you feel comfortable and greeted her customers by name!!! I’m very disappointed.

Was excited to get my nails done for the third time ever. And this place had decent reviews, so I went for it.

I got an acrylic set. Employees were nice and all. Guy who did my nails was fast. But I made a mistake in coming here. By the time I left the shop, I realized that almost all of my nails are pointed upward. It looks awful. I don’t have time to come back in before my event to get them fixed. I’m pretty disappointed. This mess cost me $35!!!!
Great prices,  clean shop,  friendly staff!  Don't let this quaint store front fool you, it has plenty of room inside

Loved the choices of sauce #5 being our favorite. Had better meat. Didn't care for the cashier at all but the bus guy was fabulous with our daughter. From Indiana if ever in the area it is worth the trip.

The food absolutely delicious. I went there for dinner. The atmosphere is nice and casual. They have all the classics but i had chicken this time. The meat was flavorful and tender and marinated well. The sides are equally great. I had ordered cheesy corn which was fantastic. They had a party going on next door but it wasn't crazy crowded. Great place for some delicious bbq.
Really good food. The diner has a bit of a cafeteria feel. Large portions, and super tasty!

This is the second time that I have been to this place and ended up dissatisfied. The first time I was ill. I suspected it was my barbecue. It was confirmed when a friend ate my leftovers and became sick. That was around 5 years ago. I visited recently, and the barbecue on my sandwich tasted old. It was three of us lunching. One person took her food back, for different reasons(I didn't bother to) which had the same meat. They remade her food and the same meat had a different color... Like it was fresh, not dark with that reheated look and taste to it. I keep hearing good things about this place, so maybe one day I will try them and they will be on point. But until then I will stick to 3 stars. The staff was nice, and the food was fast and hot... But let's work on the fresh.
Best bbq in town.  Good selection of sauces.  Had a special of burnt ends today which are outstanding.  The potato salad is excellent.
I ate with a large group and tried just about everyone's entry.  Everything tasted spectacular.
Be careful coming here they have off duty cops who will beat you senseless then arrest you on trumped up charges.
